# Introduction

This document demonstrates the use of a number of advanced page layout features to produce an attractive and usable document inspired by the Tufte handout style and the use of Tufte's styles in RMarkdown 

::: {#cell-fig-main-margin-cap .cell .caption-undefined execution_count=1}
``` {.python .cell-code}
import numpy as np
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

r = np.arange(0, 2, 0.01)
theta = 2 * np.pi * r
fig, ax = plt.subplots(
  subplot_kw = {'projection': 'polar'} 
)
ax.plot(theta, r)
ax.set_rticks([0.5, 1, 1.5, 2])
ax.grid(True)
plt.show()
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-display}
![A figure with a longer caption. The figure appears in the main column, but the caption is placed in the margin.](sample_files/figure-html/fig-main-margin-cap-output-1.png){#fig-main-margin-cap width=450 height=439}
:::
